NATIONS-COMMENT -- In hearings last week, John Bolton, President Bush's nominee to be U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, pledged to "forge a stronger relationship between the United States and the United Nations"; this kinder, gentler Bolton is exactly what the United Nations does not need; it needs the radical skepticism of the old Bolton.
780 words, by Eric A. Posner and John C. Yoo (Times special).
